trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Search service in the portal
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Search service in the portal

trans-unit.source: Add a free or standard Azure Search service to an existing subscription using the management portal
trans-unit.target: Add a free or standard Azure Search service to an existing subscription using the management portal

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Search service in the portal
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Search service in the portal

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Search is a new service that allows you to embed search functionality into custom applications.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Search is a new service that allows you to embed search functionality into custom applications.

trans-unit.source: It provides a search engine and storage of your search data, which you access and manage using the portal, a .NET SDK, or a REST API.
trans-unit.target: It provides a search engine and storage of your search data, which you access and manage using the portal, a .NET SDK, or a REST API.

trans-unit.source: Key features include auto-complete queries, fuzzy matching, hit-highlighting, faceted navigation, and multi-language support.
trans-unit.target: Key features include auto-complete queries, fuzzy matching, hit-highlighting, faceted navigation, and multi-language support.

trans-unit.source: For more information about what Search does, see [Introducing Azure Search](fundamentals-azure-search-chappell/).
trans-unit.target: For more information about what Search does, see [Introducing Azure Search](fundamentals-azure-search-chappell/).

trans-unit.source: Add Search to your subscription
trans-unit.target: Add Search to your subscription

trans-unit.source: As an administrator, you can add Search to an existing subscription at no cost when choosing the shared service, or at the standard rate when opting in for dedicated resources.
trans-unit.target: As an administrator, you can add Search to an existing subscription at no cost when choosing the shared service, or at the standard rate when opting in for dedicated resources.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: In the Jumpbar, click **New** | **Data + storage** | **Search**.
trans-unit.target: In the Jumpbar, click **New** | **Data + storage** | **Search**.

trans-unit.source: Configure the service name, pricing tier, resource group, subscription and location.
trans-unit.target: Configure the service name, pricing tier, resource group, subscription and location.

trans-unit.source: These settings are required and cannot be changed once the service is provisioned.
trans-unit.target: These settings are required and cannot be changed once the service is provisioned.

trans-unit.source: **Service name** must be unique, lower-case, under 15 characters, with no spaces.
trans-unit.target: **Service name** must be unique, lower-case, under 15 characters, with no spaces.

trans-unit.source: This name becomes part of the endpoint of your Azure Search service.
trans-unit.target: This name becomes part of the endpoint of your Azure Search service.

trans-unit.source: See [Naming Rules](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn857353.aspx) for more information about naming conventions.
trans-unit.target: See [Naming Rules](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn857353.aspx) for more information about naming conventions.

trans-unit.source: **Pricing Tier** determines capacity and billing.
trans-unit.target: **Pricing Tier** determines capacity and billing.

trans-unit.source: Both tiers provide the same features, but at different resource levels.
trans-unit.target: Both tiers provide the same features, but at different resource levels.

trans-unit.source: **Free** runs on clusters that are shared with other subscribers.
trans-unit.target: **Free** runs on clusters that are shared with other subscribers.

trans-unit.source: It offers enough capacity to try out tutorials and write proof-of-concept code, but is not intended for production applications.
trans-unit.target: It offers enough capacity to try out tutorials and write proof-of-concept code, but is not intended for production applications.

trans-unit.source: Deploying a free service typically only takes a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: Deploying a free service typically only takes a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: **Standard** runs on dedicated resources and is highly scalable.
trans-unit.target: **Standard** runs on dedicated resources and is highly scalable.

trans-unit.source: Initially, a standard service is provisioned with one replica and one partition, but you can adjust capacity once the service is created.
trans-unit.target: Initially, a standard service is provisioned with one replica and one partition, but you can adjust capacity once the service is created.

trans-unit.source: Deploying a standard service takes longer, usually about fifteen minutes.
trans-unit.target: Deploying a standard service takes longer, usually about fifteen minutes.

trans-unit.source: **Resource Groups** are containers for services and resources used for a common purpose.
trans-unit.target: **Resource Groups** are containers for services and resources used for a common purpose.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you're building a custom search application based on Azure Search, Azure Websites, Azure BLOB storage, you could create a resource group that keeps these services together in the portal management pages.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you're building a custom search application based on Azure Search, Azure Websites, Azure BLOB storage, you could create a resource group that keeps these services together in the portal management pages.

trans-unit.source: **Subscription** allows you to choose among multiple subscriptions, if you have more than one subscription.
trans-unit.target: **Subscription** allows you to choose among multiple subscriptions, if you have more than one subscription.

trans-unit.source: **Location** is the data center region.
trans-unit.target: **Location** is the data center region.

trans-unit.source: Currently, all resources must run in the same data center.
trans-unit.target: Currently, all resources must run in the same data center.

trans-unit.source: Distributing resources across multiple data centers is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Distributing resources across multiple data centers is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create** to provision the service.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create** to provision the service.

trans-unit.source: Watch for notifications in the Jumpbar.
trans-unit.target: Watch for notifications in the Jumpbar.

trans-unit.source: A notice will appear when the service is ready to use.
trans-unit.target: A notice will appear when the service is ready to use.

trans-unit.source: Find the service name and api-keys of your Azure Search service
trans-unit.target: Find the service name and api-keys of your Azure Search service

trans-unit.source: After the service is created, you can return to the portal to get the URL or `api-key`.
trans-unit.target: After the service is created, you can return to the portal to get the URL or `api-key`.

trans-unit.source: Connections to your Search service requires that you have both the URL and an `api-key` to authenticate the call.
trans-unit.target: Connections to your Search service requires that you have both the URL and an `api-key` to authenticate the call.

trans-unit.source: In the Jumpbar, click **Home** and then click the Search service to open the service dashboard.
trans-unit.target: In the Jumpbar, click **Home** and then click the Search service to open the service dashboard.

trans-unit.source: On the service dashboard, you'll see tiles for essential information, as well as the key icon for accessing the admin keys.
trans-unit.target: On the service dashboard, you'll see tiles for essential information, as well as the key icon for accessing the admin keys.

trans-unit.source: Copy the service URL and an admin key.
trans-unit.target: Copy the service URL and an admin key.

trans-unit.source: You will need them for your next task, [Test service operations](#sub-4).
trans-unit.target: You will need them for your next task, [Test service operations](#sub-4).

trans-unit.source: Upgrade to standard tier
trans-unit.target: Upgrade to standard tier

trans-unit.source: Many customers start with the free service, and then upgrade to the standard tier when query performance or storage becomes inadequate for the workloads you need to run.
trans-unit.target: Many customers start with the free service, and then upgrade to the standard tier when query performance or storage becomes inadequate for the workloads you need to run.

trans-unit.source: The standard tier gives you dedicated resources in an Azure data center that can be used only by you.
trans-unit.target: The standard tier gives you dedicated resources in an Azure data center that can be used only by you.

trans-unit.source: Search operations require both storage and service replicas.
trans-unit.target: Search operations require both storage and service replicas.

trans-unit.source: When you sign up for standard search, you can optimize service configuration to use more of whichever resource is the most important to your scenario.
trans-unit.target: When you sign up for standard search, you can optimize service configuration to use more of whichever resource is the most important to your scenario.

trans-unit.source: To use the standard tier, repeat the previous steps in this article to create a new Search service, choosing the Standard pricing tier.
trans-unit.target: To use the standard tier, repeat the previous steps in this article to create a new Search service, choosing the Standard pricing tier.

trans-unit.source: Note that setting up dedicated resources can take a while, up to 15 minutes or longer.
trans-unit.target: Note that setting up dedicated resources can take a while, up to 15 minutes or longer.

trans-unit.source: There is no in-place upgrade of the free version.
trans-unit.target: There is no in-place upgrade of the free version.

trans-unit.source: Switching to standard, with its potential for scale, requires a new service.
trans-unit.target: Switching to standard, with its potential for scale, requires a new service.

trans-unit.source: You will need to reload the indexes and documents used by your search application.
trans-unit.target: You will need to reload the indexes and documents used by your search application.

trans-unit.source: A Search service at the standard tier is created with one replica and partition each, but can be easily re-scaled at higher resource levels.
trans-unit.target: A Search service at the standard tier is created with one replica and partition each, but can be easily re-scaled at higher resource levels.

trans-unit.source: Return to the service dashboard after the service is created.
trans-unit.target: Return to the service dashboard after the service is created.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Scale** tile.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Scale** tile.

trans-unit.source: Use the sliders to add replicas, partitions, or both.
trans-unit.target: Use the sliders to add replicas, partitions, or both.

trans-unit.source: Additional replicas and partitions are billed in terms of search units.
trans-unit.target: Additional replicas and partitions are billed in terms of search units.

trans-unit.source: The total search units required to support any particular resource configuration is shown on the page, as you add resources.
trans-unit.target: The total search units required to support any particular resource configuration is shown on the page, as you add resources.

trans-unit.source: You can check [Pricing Details](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=509792) to get the per-unit billing information.
trans-unit.target: You can check [Pricing Details](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=509792) to get the per-unit billing information.

trans-unit.source: See [Limits and constraints](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798934.aspx) for help in deciding how to configure partition and replica combinations.
trans-unit.target: See [Limits and constraints](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798934.aspx) for help in deciding how to configure partition and replica combinations.

trans-unit.source: Test service operations
trans-unit.target: Test service operations

trans-unit.source: Confirming that your service is operational and accessible from a client application is the final step in configuring Search.
trans-unit.target: Confirming that your service is operational and accessible from a client application is the final step in configuring Search.

trans-unit.source: You can use either of the links below for a code-free approach to verifying service availability.
trans-unit.target: You can use either of the links below for a code-free approach to verifying service availability.

trans-unit.source: How to use Chrome Postman with Azure Search
trans-unit.target: How to use Chrome Postman with Azure Search

trans-unit.source: How to use Telerik Fiddler with Azure Search
trans-unit.target: How to use Telerik Fiddler with Azure Search

trans-unit.source: ##Next steps The following additional material shows you how to build and manage search applications that use Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: ##Next steps The following additional material shows you how to build and manage search applications that use Azure Search.

target.ept: How to use Azure Search in .NET](search-howto-dotnet-sdk.md)
